meanings.definition: Not staying the same in behavior or quality.
meanings.sent1: Her grades were inconsistent, sometimes high and sometimes low.
meanings.sent2: The weather in spring is often inconsistent, changing from warm to cold frequently.
meanings.sent3: The magician's inconsistent tricks left the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: His inconsistent performance on the field cost the team the game.
meanings.sent5: The inconsistent colors of the chameleon amazed the children at the zoo.

meanings.sent1: Their opinions on the movie were inconsistent, one loved it while the other hated it.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had an inconsistent relationship, sometimes getting along and other times arguing.
meanings.sent3: The inconsistent music choices at the party confused the guests.
meanings.sent4: The inconsistent melodies clashed in a beautiful chaos.
meanings.sent5: The inconsistent voices in the choir created a unique harmony.

meanings.definition: Not compatible or able to coexist.
meanings.sent1: The new software was inconsistent with the old system, causing errors.
meanings.sent2: Their schedules were inconsistent, making it hard to find time to meet.
meanings.sent3: The inconsistent flavors in the dish created a strange taste.
meanings.sent4: The inconsistent beliefs clashed like oil and water.
meanings.sent5: The inconsistent goals of the team led to confusion and disarray.
